# What's New in C#

> New features and improvements in each C# version. Recent additions include primary constructors (C# 12), collection expressions (C# 12), raw string literals (C# 11), and file-scoped types. Check version compatibility when using new features; target appropriate .NET version.

*Topics available: 10*

- [Breaking changes in the C# compiler](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/breaking-changes.md): Find any breaking changes in the C# compiler that you're using.
- [What's new in C# 12](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/csharp-12.md): Get an overview of the new features in C# 12.
- [What's new in C# 13](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/csharp-13.md): Get an overview of the new features in C# 13.
- [What's new in C# 14](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/csharp-14.md): Get an overview of the new features in C# 14. C# 14 ships with .NET 10.
- [The history of C#](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/csharp-version-history.md): Learn how the C# language has changed over its many releases. Learn when different features were introduced in the language.
- [The relationship between C# language features and library types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/relationships-between-language-and-library.md): Language features often rely on library types for implementation. Understand that relationship.
- [Version and update considerations for C# developers](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/version-update-considerations.md): Introducing new languages features in your library can impact the code that uses it.

## Subtopics

- [Tutorials Docs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/tutorials/llms.txt): 3 topics; Tutorials Docs documentation and reference.
